ProgramName: Master of Accountancy
EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit an English proficiency exam score. This requirement is separate from any requirements of the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS). We accept the following tests: TOEFL, IELTS, and Duolingo.
Requirements: The following are required to apply for this program: Resume or CV, Statement of Purpose, Transcripts, 3 Letters of Recommendation, GRE/GMAT not required.
Description: The Baylor Master of Accountancy (MAcc) program provides a firm foundation for a career in public accounting and industry. Within 10 months, students can complete the 33 required semester hours and gain the skills necessary to excel in the competitive business world. Our students enjoy excellent job placement and high pass rates on the CPA exam. Students can choose a general MAcc degree or a taxation track. The Baylor MAcc is designed for students with an undergraduate degree in accounting from an accredited U.S. institution. Students without an undergraduate degree in accounting should consider the Master of Taxation (MTax) program.
Accredidation: The Accounting and Business Law department holds a separate AACSB accreditation, an honor held by less than 2 percent of business schools worldwide.

ProgramName: Doctor of Nursing Practice in Adult-Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioner
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit a score from one of the following tests: TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo. The requirement is waived for applicants who have earned a bachelor's degree from a U.S. institution. The following scores are accepted: TOEFL iBT: 80, TOEFL pBT: 550, IELTS: 6.5, Duolingo: 110.
Requirements:
Completed online application and $50 application fee.
A Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) or a Master of Science in Nursing (MSN) degree from a regionally accredited institution.
A minimum of a 3.0 cumulative GPA.
Official transcripts from all academic institutions attended.
Three letters of recommendation.
A Statement of Purpose.
A current resume or curriculum vitae (CV).
A valid, unencumbered RN license to practice in the United States.
A minimum of one year of full-time RN experience in a critical care setting is preferred.
Description: The Baylor University Louise Herrington School of Nursing Doctor of Nursing Practice (DNP) program for Adult-Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioner (AGACNP) is a 75-credit hour program offered in a hybrid format, combining online and in-person learning. This program is tailored for nurses who hold a Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) degree and are looking to advance their careers to the highest level of clinical practice. The curriculum is designed to equip students with advanced skills in assessing and managing the health of acutely ill adult and older adult patients, preparing them for leadership roles in various healthcare settings. Graduates of the AGACNP track are eligible to sit for the national certification exam through the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC) or the American Association of Critical-Care Nurses (AACN), qualifying them to practice as certified Adult-Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioners.
Accredidation: The Doctor of Nursing Practice degree program at Baylor University Louise Herrington School of Nursing is accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education, 655 K Street, NW, Suite 750, Washington, DC 20001, 202-887-6791.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in American Studies
LiveDate: Applications for Fall admission typically open in early August of the preceding year.
EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit an English proficiency test score. Official TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo scores are required. Applicants who have completed a bachelor's degree or higher from a regionally accredited U.S. institution are exempt from the English proficiency exam requirement.
Description: The Master of Arts degree in American Studies is an interdisciplinary program that draws its faculty and curriculum from departments throughout the humanities and social sciences. The program emphasizes a foundation in traditional and contemporary American culture and a flexibility that encourages students to follow individual interests. Both a thesis and a non-thesis option are available. American Studies offers a joint degree program with the School of Law. Contact the departmental Graduate Program Director for more information about the J.D./M.A. in American Studies.
ScholarshipAmount: Annual stipend of at least $19,000, plus full tuition remission.

ProgramName: Doctor of Nursing Practice in Anesthesia Nursing (Army-Baylor)
Description: The Doctor of Nursing Practice (DNP) Program is a cooperative program between the U.S. Army Medical Center of Excellence (MEDCoE) at Fort Sam Houston, Texas and the Baylor University Louise Herringer School of Nursing. The program is designed to produce independent and competent anesthetists who are able to serve in all branches of the uniformed services. The program consists of a rigorous curriculum divided into two phases. The first phase consists of didactic instruction for 12 months at the MEDCoE, Fort Sam Houston, Texas. The MEDCoE offers an excellent learning environment with an experienced faculty and state-of-the-art simulation center for hands-on crisis management training. The curriculum emphasizes basic sciences in the first semester, including anatomy, physiology, pathophysiology, pharmacology, chemistry, and physics. The second semester focuses on advanced anesthesia principles. Upon completion of the didactic phase, students progress to the second phase of the program, the clinical residency. The clinical residency is a minimum of 24 months in length. The residency consists of supervised patient care in a variety of clinical settings where students are exposed to a wide spectrum of patient acuity and subspecialty anesthesia practice. Students are assigned to a military medical center and a variety of civilian hospitals for their clinical training. All students will perform a clinical rotation in a combat support hospital as part of their training.
Accredidation: The program is accredited by the Council on Accreditation of Nurse Anesthesia Educational Programs (COA).

ProgramName: PhD in Anthropology
EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit a test score that shows English proficiency unless they qualify for an exemption. Approved exams and minimum scores are: TOEFL iBT - 80, IELTS - 6.5, or DuoLingo - 110.
Requirements:
Completed online application, including the application fee.
Bachelor's degree from an accredited university.
Statement of Purpose: Please include a description of your primary research interests and why you want to pursue your graduate studies at Baylor. You should also list the name(s) of any faculty members that you have been in contact with.
Official transcripts from all universities attended.
Three letters of recommendation.
Writing Sample (10-20 pages): The sample should demonstrate your scholarly potential.
CV or Resume.
GRE scores are not required.
International applicants must also provide a score from the TOEFL, IELTS, or DuoLingo exam.
Description: The Department of Anthropology offers graduate coursework leading to a PhD in Anthropology. Our program specializes in the archaeology of complex societies and we encourage cross-disciplinary research that bridges the sciences and the humanities. We currently conduct research in Mesoamerica, the Near East, North America, and South America on a variety of topics and theoretical problems relevant to complex societies. The department encourages students to develop a course of study that takes advantage of our faculty’s strengths and the diverse resources available through other Baylor departments and programs, such as the Baylor Archaeometry Laboratory, Environmental Science, Geosciences, History, Museum Studies, and Religion. Our graduate students are also encouraged to participate in a variety of departmental research projects. As a department, we believe that field and laboratory experience are essential for our graduate students’ training. We endeavor to provide our students with opportunities to gain research experience in the field and in the laboratory in order to promote their individual research interests and future employment.

ProgramName: Master of Athletic Training
Requirements: Baylor’s MAT Program utilizes the Athletic Training Centralized Application System (ATCAS). You will apply through ATCAS and also submit a Baylor GoGrad application. You will need to identify your ATCAS ID in your GoGrad application. The Graduate School requires a minimum GPA of 2.7 for Master's programs. The GRE is not required. A minimum of 50 observation hours are required to be completed under the direct supervision of a certified athletic trainer (ATC). Prerequisite courses include: Biology with lab, Human Anatomy & Physiology I with lab, Human Anatomy & Physiology II with lab, Chemistry with lab, Physics with lab, Exercise Physiology, Biomechanics or Kinesiology, Nutrition, Psychology, and Statistics. An interview is required.
Department: Robbins College of Health and Human Sciences
Description: The Master of Athletic Training (MAT) is a full-time, two-year (six-semester) program that prepares students to become highly skilled and competent healthcare professionals. The program’s challenging curriculum will focus on critical-thinking, evidence-based practice, and advanced clinical-skills. The MAT is a cohort model, where a new group of students begins each summer. The program requires 62-hours of graduate-level coursework, which is uniquely divided between didactic, laboratory, and clinical education experiences. The program utilizes a variety of clinical experiences, including on-campus athletic teams, as well as local high schools and healthcare facilities. Students are also required to complete an immersive clinical experience during their second year, which can take place anywhere in the United States.
Accredidation: Baylor University’s Master of Athletic Training Program is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Athletic Training Education (CAATE), 6850 Austin Center Blvd., Suite 100, Austin, TX 78731-3101.

ProgramName: PhD in Biology
EnglishScore: Applicants who are not U.S. citizens are required to submit proof of English proficiency. Baylor accepts the following tests: TOEFL, IELTS, and DuoLingo. The minimum score required for the TOEFL is 80 on the iBT, the minimum score required for the IELTS is 6.5, and the minimum score for the DuoLingo English Test is 110.
Requirements: Your application will need to be complete before it is reviewed by the department. In addition to the general application requirements of the Graduate School, the following are required for the PhD program in Biology: Transcripts, Letters of Recommendation, Statement of Purpose, Résumé or Curriculum Vitae.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Biology
EnglishScore: International applicants must submit a score from one of the following testing agencies: TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo. An international applicant is exempt from the English proficiency test requirement if they have completed a bachelor's degree or higher from a U.S. institution.
Requirements: Standardized Tests: The Biology Department no longer requires the GRE general test or subject test. Statement of Purpose: Required. Please describe your motivation for pursuing graduate study, your research interests and experience, and your career goals. Applicants should identify at least one faculty member in the Biology Department with whom they would like to study. The statement should be 1-2 pages in length. Resume/CV: Required. Please provide your current curriculum vitae. Letters of Recommendation: Required. 3 letters are required. At least two letters should be from science faculty with whom you have studied or conducted research. Writing Sample: Not required.
Description: The Department of Biology offers a Master of Science (M.S.) degree program that provides students with a broad background in biology while allowing for specialization in areas such as ecology, evolution, organismal biology, and cell and molecular biology. The M.S. degree program prepares students for various careers in research, education, and industry, or for further graduate studies in a Ph.D. program. The research-based M.S. program is the terminal degree for some students, while it provides a stepping stone to a Ph.D. program for others. Coursework and research leading to the M.S. degree are offered in a broad range of biological disciplines.
ScholarshipAmount: $22,000 stipend and a full tuition waiver

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Biology – Health Professions
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit a score from a recent (within two years) English proficiency test. You may submit a score from either the TOEFL, IELTS or Duolingo.
Requirements:
Complete the online application by selecting the term you are applying for and then “Biology MA”.
A $50 non-refundable application fee is required.
Official transcripts are required from every institution you have attended. A bachelor’s degree from an accredited US institution, or the equivalent from a foreign institution, is required.
Official GRE scores are recommended but not required. Submit your scores through ETS to code 6032. If you choose to submit official GRE scores, these must be from within the last 5 years.
A statement of purpose is required. What are your aspirations for graduate study, for your career? How will a Baylor graduate degree help you achieve those aspirations? Your statement should be a minimum of 400 words, and should address the following:
- What are your motivations for pursuing a Master of Arts in Biology at Baylor University?
- How have your academic, research, or life experiences prepared you for this program?
- What are your long-term goals, and how will this program help you achieve them?
A resume or curriculum vitae (CV) is required.
Three letters of recommendation are required.
Description: The Master of Arts degree in Biology is a non-thesis program that offers a specialization in health professions. Its goal is to provide students with a strong background in the biological sciences in preparation for admission to a professional school (medical, dental, etc). This program is designed to strengthen an applicant's credentials for professional school by improving his/her GPA, providing an opportunity for a robust standardized test (MCAT/DAT) preparatory course, and reinforcing a strong academic background. To this end, students will take courses offered at the Baylor College of Medicine on the Baylor University campus and/or graduate-level science courses offered on the Baylor University campus. Most of our students will also be enrolled in a robust MCAT/DAT preparatory course in the spring.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Biomedical Engineering
EnglishScore: Applicants who are not U.S. citizens are required to submit an English proficiency test score. Baylor's Graduate School accepts the following tests: TOEFL, IELTS, PTE Academic, and Duolingo. We also accept completion of the ELS Language Centers Academic Program.
Department: School of Engineering and Computer Science
Description: The Master of Science in Biomedical Engineering (MSBE) is intended for students with a bachelor’s degree in engineering or related field. Students can obtain either a thesis-based or non-thesis MSBE, both of which prepare them for careers in industry or for advanced studies in a doctoral program. The MSBE is a joint program between the School of Engineering & Computer Science and Baylor’s Graduate School. The program requires 30 semester hours of graduate-level course work. Students must successfully complete BME 5310, 5320, 5330, and 5340. Additional courses required depend on the student’s interests and degree track (thesis or non-thesis).
ScholarshipType: Merit-based scholarships, Graduate assistantships, Baylor Graduate Fellowships

ProgramName: Master of Science in Business Analytics
EnglishScore: International applicants must submit proof of English proficiency. Accepted tests include TOEFL (minimum 80 iBT or 550 pBT), IELTS (minimum 6.5), PTE (minimum 60), Duolingo (minimum 110), or an ELS level 112 certificate.
Description: The Baylor Master of Science in Business Analytics (MSBA) is an innovative, 10-month program designed to build upon your undergraduate degree with in-depth knowledge of business analytics and data-driven strategy. The MSBA develops leaders who can leverage data to solve business problems and gain a competitive advantage. You will learn the tools and techniques to analyze data, build predictive models and communicate insights effectively. You will also have the opportunity to apply your knowledge and skills through real-world practicum experiences.
Accredidation: The Hankamer School of Business is accredited by AACSB International.

ProgramName: PhD in Chemistry & Biochemistry
EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit a score from one of the following tests. Scores must be no more than two years old. TOEFL iBT: minimum score of 80. IELTS: minimum score of 6.5. Duolingo: minimum score of 110.
Description: The doctoral degree in chemistry and biochemistry at Baylor University is a research-intensive program that prepares students for a wide range of careers in industry, government, and academia. Graduate students at Baylor are able to choose a research director from any of our internationally-recognized faculty who are pursuing cutting-edge research in analytical, physical, inorganic, organic, and theoretical chemistry, as well as biochemistry. Baylor graduate students enjoy small research group sizes that foster close student-mentor relationships. They also have full access to a wide-range of state-of-the-art instrumentation and facilities. A Ph.D. degree in chemistry or biochemistry from Baylor University provides students with the critical-thinking skills and the practical experience to be innovators and to solve challenging problems in the ever-changing technical landscape.
ScholarshipType: Teaching Assistantship, Research Assistantship, Presidential Scholarship

ProgramName: Master of Music in Church Music
EnglishScore: International students whose native language is not English are required to take an English proficiency exam and meet the minimum scores for admission. The Graduate School accepts TOEFL (iBT), IELTS, PTE, or Duolingo.
Requirements: A bachelor's degree in music from a nationally accredited undergraduate institution is required. Equivalent training may be accepted in some cases. Official transcripts from each institution attended are required. A minimum 3.0 GPA is required. 3 Letters of Recommendation are required. A Résumé or CV and a Statement of Purpose are required. A Writing Sample is required; it should demonstrate the applicant’s ability to conduct research and to write at a level appropriate for graduate study. Typically this is a paper written for an undergraduate course in music history or music theory. The suggested length is 10-15 pages. All applicants must submit a prescreening audition video. An audition is required for admission to the Master of Music program. The GRE is not required.
Concentration: organ, choral conducting, collaborative piano, and worship leadership
Description: The Master of Music in Church Music is a professional graduate degree which aims to equip students with the practical skills and the scholarly acumen necessary for a vital and effective music and worship ministry. It is a sixty-one hour program with several areas of concentration: organ, choral conducting, collaborative piano, and worship leadership. It is designed to be completed in two years of full-time study.
Accredidation: The Baylor University School of Music is accredited by the National Association of Schools of Music (NASM).

ProgramName: Doctor of Musical Arts in Church Music
EnglishScore: Applicants who are not U.S. citizens are required to submit an official score report from one of the following tests of English proficiency: TOEFL (minimum 80 iBT), IELTS (minimum 6.5), or Duolingo (minimum 110). The test of English proficiency is waived if the applicant has a bachelor's degree from a U.S. accredited institution.
Description: The Doctor of Musical Arts in Church Music is the School of Music’s most advanced professional degree. It is designed to prepare its recipient for a career that combines the highest level of artistic and practical accomplishment with significant scholarly achievement. The program is specifically intended to prepare students for careers as directors of music in churches, teachers of church music in colleges, universities, and seminaries, and denominational leaders in church music. This degree requires 46 semester hours of graduate study beyond a master’s degree in church music. The program of study includes a core of coursework in hymnology, worship, philosophy, and administration of church music. Students must also complete at least two of three available concentrations. A professional dissertation is the capstone experience.
Accredidation: The Baylor University School of Music is a member of the National Association of Schools of Music.
ScholarshipAmount: $12,000 to $16,000 stipend plus full tuition waiver

ProgramName: PhD in Church Music
EnglishScore: International applicants whose native language is not English must submit a score from one of the following tests of English proficiency: TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo. The minimum required score for the internet-based TOEFL (iBT) is 80. The minimum required score for the IELTS is 6.5. The minimum required score for Duolingo is 110. Completion of Level 112 from an ELS Language Center is also accepted as proof of English proficiency.
Requirements: A 1-2 page statement of purpose describing your musical background, career goals, and reasons for applying to the graduate program at Baylor. PhD applicants are required to submit a research paper, preferably on a musical topic. Master's theses are also acceptable.
Description: The Doctor of Philosophy degree in Church Music is offered for the purpose of training scholars for teaching careers at the college, university, or seminary level. The degree requires broad and comprehensive knowledge of church music, a specific area of specialization for research, and a command of research skills and methods. All students must develop a general knowledge of Christian worship, theology, music history, music theory, and performance. Each student will also select a major area for research from one of three areas of study: ethnomusicology, musicology, or worship studies. Those selecting ethnomusicology or musicology will further specify a research focus.
Accredidation: The Baylor University School of Music is a member of the National Association of Schools of Music.
ScholarshipAmount: Full tuition scholarship and a $21,000 stipend

ProgramName: Doctor of Psychology in Clinical Psychology
Requirements: The statement of purpose should be 2 to 3 pages in length and describe your interests in our program, your career goals, and the factors that have led you to pursue the Psy.D. degree at Baylor. Please attach a current resume or CV that includes your educational and professional experience. Be sure to note any research experience, presentations, and publications. 3 letters of recommendation are required. The GRE is not required for admission to this program. An interview is required for admission to the program.
Description: Baylor’s Doctor of Psychology (Psy.D.) degree in clinical psychology is a 5-year, full-time program of study that includes 4 years of coursework and a 1-year pre-doctoral internship. The primary goal of our program is to train students as health service psychologists to provide evidence-based psychological services to a diverse public. A secondary goal is to train students to be consumers and evaluators of research, and to a lesser extent, producers of applied clinical research. The Psy.D. program is built upon the practitioner-scholar model of training for the professional practice of psychology. The program values and respects the empirical basis of scientific psychology as the foundation for the practice of clinical psychology.
Accredidation: Baylor University’s Psy.D. Program in Clinical Psychology is accredited by the American Psychological Association (APA). Questions related to the program’s accredited status should be directed to the Commission on Accreditation: Office of Program Consultation and Accreditation American Psychological Association 750 1st Street, NE, Washington, DC 20002 Phone: (202) 336-5979 / E-mail: apaaccred@apa.org Web: www.apa.org/ed/accreditation
ScholarshipAmount: Full tuition remission and a stipend

ProgramName: Master of Music in Collaborative Piano
EnglishScore: All international applicants whose native language is not English must submit a score from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), the Duolingo English Test, or the Pearson Test of English (PTE). Minimum scores are 80 (iBT TOEFL), 6.5 (IELTS), 110 (Duolingo), or 60 (PTE). This requirement is waived if the applicant has received a degree from a U.S. institution.
Requirements: Complete the online application, pay the $50 application fee, and submit the following materials: Official transcripts from all institutions from which a degree was earned, Three letters of recommendation, and School of Music requirements.
Description: The Master of Music degree in collaborative piano offers an intensive course of study for pianists who wish to pursue a career working with singers and instrumentalists. Students receive weekly coachings on vocal and instrumental repertoire, lyric diction, and piano ensemble playing. Ample performance opportunities include degree recitals, studio recitals, master classes, opera and choral productions, and other venues. Students have the opportunity to study with internationally acclaimed faculty.
Accredidation: The Baylor University School of Music is a member of the National Association of Schools of Music (NASM).
ScholarshipAmount: Full tuition waiver and a competitive stipend

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Communication
EnglishScore: Official TOEFL or IELTS scores for international applicants are required. The Graduate School recommends a minimum TOEFL score of 80 on the internet-based test (iBT), a minimum overall score of 6.5 on the IELTS, or a minimum of 110 on the Duolingo English Test.
Description: The M.A. program in Communication is an advanced, comprehensive course of study focused on the theories, methods, and applications of human communication. The degree offers students the chance to prepare for a variety of communication-related careers, or it can be a pathway to doctoral studies. The program offers tracks in rhetoric and interpersonal communication. M.A. students are admitted into a particular track but are encouraged to take classes across both areas of study. Each area has a specific focus for study, which shapes the student’s coursework and overall graduate school experience.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Communication Sciences & Disorders
EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit a test score that demonstrates English proficiency, unless they meet one of the exemptions listed below. Test options: TOEFL: For the internet-based test (iBT), a total score of 80 is required. IELTS: A score of 6.5 is required. Duolingo: A score of 110 is required.
Requirements: A completed online application and the non-refundable application fee. Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended. Three letters of recommendation are required. A Statement of Purpose is required. A Résumé or Curriculum Vitae is required. The GRE is not required for admission to this program. A minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0 is required. Prerequisite Courses: Statistics, biological science, physical science (physics or chemistry), and social/behavioral science. The Department also requires the following American Speech-Language-Hearing Association (ASHA) specified courses for certification: Phonetics, Anatomy and Physiology of Speech and Hearing, Speech and Hearing Science, Normal Speech and Language Development.
Department: Robbins College of Health and Human Sciences
Description: The Master of Science (M.S.) degree program in Communication Sciences and Disorders at Baylor University is a two-year, nationally-ranked graduate program that provides academic and clinical education to prepare students for professional careers as speech-language pathologists. Students will learn the principles and methods of prevention, assessment, and intervention for people with a wide variety of communication and swallowing disorders. The M.S. program is designed to help students meet the academic and clinical requirements for the Certificate of Clinical Competence in Speech-Language Pathology (CCC-SLP) from the American Speech-Language-Hearing Association (ASHA) and for a Texas license in speech-language pathology.
Accredidation: The Master of Science (M.S.) education program in speech-language pathology at Baylor University is accredited by the Council on Academic Accreditation in Audiology and Speech-Language Pathology of the American Speech-Language-Hearing Association, 2200 Research Boulevard, #310, Rockville, MD 20850, 800-498-2071 or 301-296-5700.

ProgramName: PhD in Communication Sciences & Disorders
EnglishScore: Applicants who are not U.S. citizens are required to submit an official score report from one of the following tests of English proficiency: TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo. This is required of all non-U.S. citizens, except for non-U.S. citizens who have obtained a bachelor's degree or higher from a U.S. accredited institution.
Requirements: An applicant for the Ph.D. program in Communication Sciences and Disorders must hold a master's degree in communication sciences and disorders, or a closely related discipline from an accredited institution. Applicants must meet the general requirements for admission to the Graduate School. A complete application to the Ph.D. program in Communication Sciences and Disorders includes the following: Completed online application and application fee; Official transcripts from every institution of higher learning from which the applicant received 12 or more credit hours; Official GRE scores (the GRE requirement is waived if you have an advanced degree or 5 years of experience); Statement of purpose or letter of intent; Resume or Curriculum Vitae; Three letters of recommendation (should be from individuals who can assess your academic and research potential).
Department: Robbins College of Health and Human Sciences
Description: The primary objective of the PhD program is to prepare students to become independent scholars and researchers who, through their own research contributions, can advance the knowledge base in the discipline of human communication sciences and disorders. Students develop expertise in a specific area of study and acquire the skills necessary to conduct research, as well as become effective teachers at the university level. We have faculty with expertise in audiology, speech-language pathology, and hearing science. Our program offers an interdisciplinary approach to research which encourages students to develop a course of study that addresses research questions from multiple perspectives. To this end, students are encouraged to select mentors and committee members from both inside and outside the department, and to engage in research both in and outside of our department laboratories. The doctoral program prepares individuals for a variety of career opportunities, including academic and research careers in university settings, research and leadership positions in clinical settings such as hospitals and schools, and positions in government and industry.
ScholarshipAmount: Full tuition coverage and a stipend

ProgramName: Master of Science in Communication Sciences & Disorders (Online)
Requirements:
To be considered for admission to the Baylor University Graduate School, you must:
- Have a bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited U.S. institution or a recognized international institution.
- Complete the online application, including a nonrefundable application fee.
- Submit official transcripts from every institution where you have earned 12 or more credit hours.
- Prerequisite Coursework in Communication Sciences & Disorders is required.
You will also be required to submit:
- A minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
- 3 Letters of Recommendation
- Resume/Vita
- Statement of Purpose
- No GRE required
Department: Robbins College of Health and Human Sciences
Description: Baylor University’s online Master of Science in Communication Sciences and Disorders program prepares aspiring speech-language pathologists (SLPs) to work in a variety of professional settings, including schools, hospitals, and clinics. Delivered through the Department of Communication Sciences and Disorders, the Speech@Baylor program provides students with a strong academic and clinical foundation to prevent, assess, diagnose, and treat speech, language, social communication, cognitive communication, and swallowing disorders in children and adults. The program emphasizes evidence-based practice and compassionate, patient-centered care. Throughout the curriculum, students will integrate research, theory, and clinical practice to provide ethical and effective care to diverse populations. Our faculty are experts in the field who will serve as mentors and guides as you become an aspiring SLP. Students attend live online classes and complete clinical placements in their communities or at one of our partner sites. The online format enables students from across the United States to experience a Baylor education without relocating.
Accredidation: The Master of Science (M.S.) education program in speech-language pathology (residential and distance education) at Baylor University is a Candidate for Accreditation by the Council on Academic Accreditation in Audiology and Speech-Language Pathology (CAA) of the American Speech-Language-Hearing Association, 2200 Research Boulevard, #310, Rockville, MD 20850, 800-498-2071 or 301-296-5700. Candidacy is a “preaccreditation” status with the CAA, awarded to developing or emerging programs for a maximum period of 5 years. This program has an accreditation visit scheduled for the 2023-2024 academic year.

ProgramName: Master of Music in Composition
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English are required to submit a score from one of the following English proficiency tests: TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo.
Requirements:
All applications to the Master of Music in Composition must be submitted through the Baylor Graduate School application portal. The following materials are required for an application to be considered complete:
- Complete the Baylor University Graduate School Application online. The application fee is $50.
- Portfolio: A portfolio of 3-5 original compositions must be submitted online with the Graduate School application. Scores should be uploaded as PDF files and recordings as MP3 files. It is best to include both a score and a recording for each work.
- Writing Sample: An academic writing sample (term paper, analysis paper, etc.) is required. The paper may be on any musical topic and should demonstrate the applicant’s ability to write prose and develop a cogent argument.
- Résumé: A current résumé or curriculum vitae is required.
- Statement of Purpose: A statement of purpose is required.
- Letters of Recommendation: Three letters of recommendation are required.
- Transcripts: Transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions are required.
- Test of English Language Proficiency: All international applicants must submit scores from the TOEFL, IELTS, or DuoLingo exams.
- Interview: Some applicants may be invited to an online interview with the composition faculty.
Description:
The Master of Music degree in composition provides student composers with opportunities for advanced creative work and the development of a personal compositional voice. Graduate composers study privately with our composition faculty and participate in a weekly composition seminar. The curriculum also includes advanced studies in music theory, musicology, and other areas of music to complement the student's background and interests. The graduate composition student has many opportunities to have their works performed on student and faculty recitals.

Baylor composition students write for a wide variety of media including solo instruments, voice, chamber ensembles, choir, band, and orchestra. Premieres of student works are common events in the School of Music, and composers have opportunities to collaborate with student and faculty performers in a variety of settings. The School of Music regularly hosts guest composers and performers for residencies that include lectures, masterclasses, and concerts, providing graduate students with opportunities for personal interaction with these distinguished artists.

The two-year MM in Composition degree culminates with the public performance of a thesis recital, a substantial original work or a collection of shorter works composed during the course of study. This recital is accompanied by a document that provides a theoretical analysis of the recital compositions.
Accredidation: The Baylor University School of Music is a member of the National Association of Schools of Music and the Texas Association of Music Schools. Baylor University is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools.
ScholarshipAmount: Full tuition waiver and a stipend of approximately $10,000/year for assistantships

ProgramName: Master of Science in Computer Science

Description: The Master of Science in Computer Science (MSCS) degree program is designed for students who want to broaden and deepen their understanding of computer science. Students in the Baylor MSCS program can choose between a thesis and non-thesis option. The thesis option allows students to participate in state-of-the-art research with one of the Computer Science faculty and is excellent preparation for doctoral studies. The non-thesis option allows students to expand their knowledge of cutting-edge computer science topics and may be completed more quickly than the thesis option. Most students take two years to complete the degree, but students in the non-thesis option may be able to finish in one-and-a-half years.

Description: The PhD in Computer Science offers students the opportunity to study at the highest levels with our world-class faculty. Students are typically funded throughout their time in the program, including tuition remission and a stipend. We work with students to develop individualized plans of study based on their interests and our faculty research strengths. PhD students work closely with a faculty mentor to conduct novel research. This research is expected to result in scholarly publications and a dissertation. Graduates of our PhD program are well-prepared to go into industrial research labs and academic positions.

Description: Baylor's online Master of Science in Computer Science (MSCS) provides students with the advanced skills and knowledge they need to succeed in the fast-paced and ever-changing world of technology. The program is designed for working professionals who want to advance their careers in computer science but need the flexibility of an online program. The curriculum is rigorous and challenging, but it is also flexible and adaptable to the needs of each student. Students can choose to specialize in one of three areas: software engineering, data science, or cybersecurity. The program is taught by experienced and knowledgeable faculty who are experts in their fields. The faculty is committed to providing students with the best possible education and preparing them for successful careers in computer science.

ProgramName: Certificate in Computer Systems Engineering
EnglishScore: All applicants who are not U.S. citizens or permanent residents must submit proof of English proficiency. Baylor’s Graduate School accepts official scores from the TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, or Duolingo exams. Completion of Level 112 of the Intensive English Program from an ELS Language Center is also accepted.
Description: The Certificate in Computer Systems Engineering is a new and exciting program for graduate students interested in pursuing a career that bridges the gap between hardware and software. The program is designed to provide students with a strong foundation in both computer hardware and software design. Students in the program will take a variety of courses that cover topics such as computer architecture, digital logic, and operating systems. In addition, students will have the opportunity to participate in hands-on projects and research that will allow them to apply their knowledge to real-world problems. The Certificate in Computer Systems Engineering is a great way for students to gain the skills and knowledge they need to succeed in the ever-changing world of computer engineering.

ProgramName: Master of Music in Conducting
EnglishScore: International applicants must submit a test of English proficiency. Baylor accepts TOEFL, IELTS, and Duolingo.
Description:
The Master of Music in conducting is offered in three areas of concentration: choral, orchestral, and wind band. The conducting program provides students with the opportunity to refine their conducting gesture, to broaden their knowledge of repertoire, to expand their score study and rehearsal techniques, and to develop their musical leadership skills in a Christian environment that encourages the highest standards of musical performance and scholarship.

The primary focus of the graduate conducting student’s curriculum is applied conducting lessons, conducting seminars, and ensemble participation. In addition, students have numerous podium opportunities as assistant conductors of major ensembles, conductors of studio and lab ensembles, conductors of department recitals, and as guest conductors with major ensembles.
Accredidation: Baylor University is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Music. The undergraduate and graduate curricula in music have been and are approved by the Commission on Accreditation and the Commission on Community/Junior College Accreditation, as appropriate.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Curriculum and Instruction (Education)

Description: The Master of Arts in Curriculum and Instruction is designed to prepare master teachers, educational leaders, and instructional specialists for a variety of educational settings. Through the program, students develop an advanced knowledge base of learning, curriculum, and instruction and are able to apply this knowledge to the creation, implementation, and evaluation of curriculum, instruction, and assessment in school and school-related settings. Advanced professional skills in curriculum, pedagogy, technology, and research are emphasized. The program includes the option of a thirty-hour non-thesis program or a thirty-hour program with thesis.
ScholarshipType: Dean's Scholarship, Baylor Graduate Scholarship, Assistantships

Please describe your academic and research interests, relevant professional experiences, and career goals. International Applicants: Please see the Additional Requirements for International Applicants.

ProgramName: PhD in Curriculum and Teaching
EnglishScore: Baylor University requires a satisfactory score on one of the following tests of English language for non-native English speakers who do not hold a bachelor’s degree from a U.S. accredited institution: TOEFL (The Graduate School's minimum score for the iBT is 80; The minimum for the paper-based test (pBT) is 550), IELTS (The Graduate School's minimum score on the IELTS is 6.5), or Duolingo (The Graduate School's minimum score on the Duolingo is 110). Description: The Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) in Curriculum & Teaching is designed to develop leaders in the field of education who can fill a variety of roles in universities, school districts, and educational organizations. The program’s focus is to provide students with the theoretical and practical knowledge needed to meet the challenges that confront educators today. The PhD in Curriculum & Teaching provides a balance of theoretical and applied knowledge with an emphasis on research. The program is designed for individuals with a master’s degree in curriculum and instruction, or a related field, who desire a comprehensive program of study in curriculum and teaching and an introduction to educational research.

ProgramName: Master of Fine Arts in Directing (Theatre Arts)
EnglishScore: For international applicants, a TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo score is accepted. The recommended minimum score for the TOEFL is 80, for the IELTS is 6.5, and for the Duolingo English Test is 110. Completion of level 112 of the English for Academic Purposes program from an ELS Language Center with a grade of B or better also fulfills the requirement.
Requirements: To be considered for the MFA Directing Program, candidates must first apply to the Baylor University Graduate School. Application to the Graduate School requires: Official Transcripts, Three letters of recommendation, A formal application. In addition, the Department of Theatre Arts requires the following supplemental application materials for consideration for the MFA Directing Program: A current resume documenting directing experience, A statement of purpose in which you address your personal and professional goals for pursuing an MFA in Directing, A directing portfolio, An on-campus interview/audition.
Description: The M.F.A. in Directing is an intensive, three-year program focused on developing theatre directors who are Christian artists and scholars. We are interested in emerging directors who are collaborative artists, eager to explore the world through a variety of theatrical lenses, and excited to engage with a diversity of texts and performance styles. With a small cohort size and a low student-to-faculty ratio, we offer personal mentorship from a faculty of professional artists and scholars. Our students develop their own directing practice through hands-on experience and a sequence of directing classes and seminars, including Theatre History, Dramatic Literature, and Pedagogy. Baylor Theatre's production season offers many opportunities for our directors to practice their craft in a variety of venues and with a range of production support. Every directing student will direct a fully-supported production as their thesis project.
Accredidation: Baylor Theatre is accredited by the National Association of Schools of Theatre (NAST).
ScholarshipAmount: All students accepted into the program receive a full tuition waiver, a generous yearly stipend ($23,000), and a research/travel budget.
ScholarshipType: Graduate Assistantship with full tuition waiver and stipend

ProgramName: Master of Divinity with Master of Science in Education Joint Degree

For the M.S.Ed. in Educational Psychology portion, requirements include a Statement of Purpose and three letters of recommendation. The GRE is not required for the M.Div and is optional for the M.S.Ed.

Description: The Master of Divinity/Master of Science in Education (MDiv/MSEd) is a joint degree program between Baylor's George W. Truett Theological Seminary and the School of Education. The MDiv/MSEd degree is an academically rigorous program intended to prepare students who plan to serve in educational ministries, church administration, and teaching in schools, including college and university settings. Students graduate with two degrees, an MDiv from Truett Seminary and an MSEd in Educational Psychology from the School of Education. The program requires 90 total hours, a reduction from the 111 hours required if both degrees were completed separately.
Accredidation: Truett Seminary is accredited by the Association of Theological Schools in the United States and Canada (ATS), and the following degree programs are approved: MDiv, MACM, MTS, DMin. Baylor University is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges (SACSCOC) to award baccalaureate, masters, and doctorate degrees.

ProgramName: Master of Divinity with Master of Arts Joint Degree

Description: The joint MDiv/MA degree is offered by Baylor University's George W. Truett Theological Seminary and the Graduate School. This program offers students the opportunity to combine the professional Master of Divinity (MDiv) degree with the academic Master of Arts (MA) degree. Students may pursue an MA in any of the fields offered in the Religion Department: Old Testament, New Testament, Theological Studies, or Historical Studies.
Accredidation: The George W. Truett Theological Seminary of Baylor University is accredited by the Association of Theological Schools in the United States and Canada, and the following degree programs are approved: MDiv, MACM, MTS, DMin, PhD.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Economics
EnglishScore: International Applicants must also submit TOEFL or IELTS scores (unless they qualify for an exception). The department requires a minimum score of 100 on the TOEFL iBT.

Description: The Master of Science in Economics provides a deep and rigorous training in modern economic theory and econometrics. The curriculum trains students to use and apply economic models and econometric techniques to analyze real world phenomena. Students will acquire advanced skills in analytical and quantitative methods from both a theoretical and an applied perspective. The program can be completed in as little as 10 months and has been designated by the U.S. government as a STEM degree program (science, technology, engineering and mathematics).

ProgramName: Doctor of Education in Learning & Organizational Change (Online)
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit a score from one of the following tests of English proficiency: TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo. The minimum required scores are: TOEFL iBT score of 80, TOEFL pBT score of 550, IELTS score of 6.5, or Duolingo score of 110. This requirement may be waived for applicants who have completed a bachelor's or master's degree from a U.S. institution.
Description: The online Doctor of Education (Ed.D.) in Learning and Organizational Change is an online professional doctoral degree program designed for leaders in various professional settings including K-12, higher education, corporate, non-profit, government, and military who are interested in becoming more effective change agents in their organizations. The program’s curriculum is grounded in the belief that leaders must understand how people learn and how organizations change in order to lead effectively. Leaders must also possess the professional knowledge, skills, and dispositions necessary to design and implement innovative and effective systems for learning and organizational improvement. Students in the program develop these essential capacities by engaging in a relevant, challenging, and fast-paced curriculum that blends theory and practice. The Ed.D. program challenges students to hone their analytic and problem-solving skills in order to address learning and leadership challenges within their own organizational contexts. The program requires 54 semester hours of coursework which includes two required immersion experiences that connect with coursework. The program is specifically designed to be completed in three years.

ProgramName: Doctor of Education in Educational Leadership K-12
EnglishScore: Applicants who are not U.S. citizens are required to submit proof of English proficiency. We require the following minimum scores: a minimum TOEFL score of 80 on the internet-based test (iBT) or 550 on the paper-based test (pBT); a minimum overall IELTS score of 6.5; a minimum DuoLingo score of 110; Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic: 60.
Requirements: The EdD in K-12 Educational Leadership is for experienced educators who want to continue working while pursuing a doctorate. A Master's degree is required. Three years of K-12 teaching experience is required. Teacher certification and principal certification are both required. An interview will be required as a final step for admission. Application requirements include a résumé or curriculum vitae, statement of purpose, three letters of recommendation, and a writing sample. The GRE is not required.
Description: The Baylor Doctor of Education (EdD) in K-12 Educational Leadership is an online cohort-based program for leaders of schools, districts, and other educational organizations who seek to bring about substantive, lasting improvement. The program is designed for working professionals, providing the flexibility of online coursework with the rigor of a Baylor EdD. Students advance through the program with a cohort of fellow educators, creating a built-in support system for each student. Baylor’s EdD in K-12 Educational Leadership prepares graduates for a variety of leadership roles in both public and private K-12 educational settings. Graduates assume roles such as superintendents, assistant superintendents, central office administrators, principals, and other key leadership positions.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Education in Educational Psychology
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit a score from one of the following tests to demonstrate English proficiency: TOEFL, IELTS, PTE Academic, Duolingo English Test (DET). This requirement is waived for applicants who have completed a bachelor's degree or higher from a U.S. institution or from an institution in a country where English is the official language.

Description:
The Master of Science in Education (M.S.Ed.) in Educational Psychology is designed to provide you with a unique perspective on learning and human development as you work to develop research-based practices that improve learning environments in schools, homes, and community settings.

Our program provides a broad curriculum with an emphasis in learning and development, but you may also take classes in quantitative methods, gifted and talented education, special education, and other areas of interest. You can design a course of study that aligns with your specific career goals in areas such as:

Teaching
Instructional design and coordination
Youth and family ministry
Community agency program development
Research
Preparation for doctoral study
The M.S.Ed. in Educational Psychology offers thesis and non-thesis options. The thesis option prepares you for further graduate study at the doctoral level, while the non-thesis option provides a broader course of study to better prepare you for employment immediately following graduation.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Education in Educational Psychology with a Concentration in Gifted & Talented Education

Description: The Master of Science in Education (MSEd) in Educational Psychology with a concentration in Gifted and Talented Education is a fully online, 36-hour program that is designed for individuals who desire to develop expertise in meeting the needs of gifted and talented students. The coursework provides in-depth understanding of the nature and needs of gifted students, curriculum and instruction for gifted students, and the social and emotional needs of gifted students. An additional focus is on creativity. Graduates of this program may become a gifted and talented coordinator/specialist in a school district, a teacher of gifted and talented students, or a gifted and talented instructional coach. The program does not offer teacher certification. Students take 12 courses, each lasting 8 weeks. Students complete the program in two years or less.

ProgramName: PhD in Educational Psychology
EnglishScore: Baylor University requires a minimum score on one of the following tests of English proficiency for all applicants who are not U.S. citizens or permanent residents: TOEFL (minimum score of 80 iBT), IELTS (minimum score of 6.5), or Duolingo (minimum score of 110). The English proficiency requirement is waived for applicants who are citizens of countries where English is the official language. It is also waived for applicants who have obtained a bachelor's degree or higher from a regionally accredited U.S. institution.
Requirements: Applicants must have a bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited institution and a competitive GPA (3.0 or higher is recommended). Required documents include: official transcripts from all universities attended, a Statement of Purpose that communicates your academic and research interests, career goals, and the faculty with whom you are interested in working, a Resume or CV that summarizes your academic and professional experiences, and three letters of recommendation that speak to your academic abilities and potential for graduate study. The GRE General Test is optional for admission in the 2024-2025 application cycle. However, some faculty may strongly recommend that applicants take the test.
Description: The Ph.D. in Educational Psychology is designed to prepare you to become a university professor or a leader in other educational settings. Our graduates have pursued successful careers at major research universities, in liberal arts colleges, and in a variety of other applied settings, including the military, research corporations, school districts, and state education agencies. The graduate program in Educational Psychology focuses on learning, development, and instruction across the lifespan. You’ll have the chance to explore quantitative methods and educational research. The program features a faculty-student mentorship model where you’ll work closely with a faculty mentor on research and teaching. You’ll become part of a research team with your mentor and fellow graduate students. There are numerous opportunities to co-author publications in research journals and present research at national and international conferences. The program has three specializations from which you can choose: Gifted and Talented, Learning and Development, and Quantitative Methods.

ProgramName: PhD in Educational Psychology with a Concentration in Gifted & Talented Education

Description: The Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) degree in Educational Psychology is an intensive, research-oriented degree that prepares students for careers in research, college and university teaching, and other leadership positions in education and human services. The Department of Educational Psychology offers concentrations in: Gifted and Talented Education, Learning and Development, Quantitative Methods, and Special Education. Graduates from our program have received tenure-track faculty positions in universities and colleges and leadership positions in state departments of education, regional education service centers, school districts, and private organizations.

Description: The Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE) PhD program is a research-oriented degree program. The purpose of the program is to produce graduates who are able to conduct independent research in electrical and computer engineering at the highest levels of originality and quality. The degree is granted upon demonstration of ability to do independent research.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Electrical & Computer Engineering

Description: The graduate program in electrical and computer engineering prepares students for leadership roles in research, development, and design positions in industry and academia. The master of science degree is offered with both thesis and non-thesis options. The Doctor of Philosophy degree is also offered. Both degrees provide students with a strong background in the fundamentals of electrical engineering while permitting them to pursue in-depth study and research in a specialized area.

Concentration: Electrical and Computer Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, General Engineering
Description: The Master of Engineering (MEng) degree program is a non-thesis professional master’s degree focused on providing advanced technical skills to our students. In addition, the degree program provides professional development in the areas of leadership, management, and communication. The degree can be completed in as little as three semesters. The MEng degree is available in three concentrations: Electrical and Computer Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, and a general Engineering option which allows students more flexibility. The program is flexible and allows for students to focus in areas of their interest. With a focus on application and design, this degree prepares students for a variety of careers in industry.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in English

Description: The M.A. is a two-year program that prepares students for Ph.D. work and for teaching at the secondary or junior college level. The program is flexible, giving students freedom to explore their interests and prepare for their chosen career path. We offer two options for the M.A. degree: a thesis option and a non-thesis option. The thesis option allows students to work closely with a faculty member on an extended research project and is recommended for those who plan to pursue a Ph.D. The non-thesis option allows students to take a wider range of courses and is a good option for those who plan to teach at the secondary or community college level. In addition to a variety of courses in British and American literature, we regularly offer classes on literary theory, religion and literature, and rhetoric and composition. Students may choose to take courses in any of these areas.

Description:
Baylor’s PhD program in English offers a traditional course of study in English and American literary history. The curriculum provides a solid grounding in literary history and theory, while affording students the opportunity to concentrate their work in a major field and one minor field.

The department is committed to its students’ intellectual development as scholars and their professional development as teachers. The department provides students with rigorous training in scholarship and with individual guidance toward professional publication. The PhD program prepares students for positions as scholar-teachers in colleges and universities.
ScholarshipType: Assistantship with full tuition remission and stipend

ProgramName: PhD in Entrepreneurship
EnglishScore: International applicants must submit a score from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), or the Duolingo English Test. The Graduate School requires a minimum TOEFL score of 80 (iBT) or IELTS score of 6.5 or Duolingo score of 110.
Description:
The PhD in Entrepreneurship prepares students to become highly-skilled researchers and inspirational teachers at top universities around the world. Baylor's program is distinct because of its deep emphasis on mentorship and its apprenticeship-style of learning.

Students in the program work closely with faculty, collaborating on research projects from the very beginning. This hands-on experience provides students with the practical skills and knowledge they need to be successful.

This mentoring model has a track record of success. Graduates of Baylor's program have secured tenure-track positions at leading research universities such as Indiana University, University of Georgia, University of Tennessee, University of Oklahoma, Texas Christian University, University of Louisville, University of Missouri, University of Mississippi, Iowa State University, Syracuse University, Kansas State University, Oklahoma State University and Oregon State University.

The PhD in Entrepreneurship is a four-year, full-time, in-residence program. The program is designed to develop the research and teaching skills needed for a successful academic career.
Accredidation: Hankamer School of Business is accredited by AACSB International.
ScholarshipAmount: Full tuition waiver and a $32,000/year stipend

ProgramName: Master of Science in Environmental Science
EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit proof of English proficiency. An official score report from one of the following tests is required: TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo. Minimum score requirements are 80 on the TOEFL iBT, 6.5 on the IELTS, or 110 on the Duolingo English Test.
Requirements: Application submitted online, Official transcripts from all institutions from which a degree was received, Statement of Purpose, Three letters of recommendation, Resume or curriculum vitae, GRE Scores (optional), International applicants may have additional requirements.
Description: The Department of Environmental Science offers graduate education leading to both Master of Science (M.S.) and Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) degrees. Our primary objective is to provide an educational experience of the highest quality in order to prepare our students for careers in research, teaching, and environmental management. Strengths of the department include aquatic systems science, ecotoxicology and risk assessment, environmental chemistry and health.
ScholarshipAmount: A base stipend of $21,000 and full tuition remission

ProgramName: PhD in Environmental Science
EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit a test score from one of the following testing agencies: TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo. The scores must be no more than two years old at the time of application. Minimum scores are 80 for TOEFL iBT, 6.5 for IELTS, or 110 for Duolingo.
Requirements:
In addition to the general requirements for admission to the Graduate School, the following are required for admission to the PhD in environmental science:

An earned master's degree in an environmentally related field from an accredited university is required prior to enrollment.
Official transcripts of all previous academic work, both undergraduate and graduate, must be submitted to the Graduate School.
Three letters of recommendation from individuals who know the applicant's academic and research potential are required.
A statement of purpose outlining the applicant’s academic and research background, career goals, and area of research interest is required.
A curriculum vitae or resume is required.
TOEFL or IELTS scores for international applicants whose native language is not English, as required by the Graduate School.
Description: The Ph.D. in Environmental Science is an interdisciplinary degree program involving faculty from the departments of Biology, Chemistry and Biochemistry, Environmental Science, Geosciences, Public Health, and Statistical Science. The program is committed to excellence in research and teaching, and provides students with a broad background and understanding of environmental issues from a scientific perspective and specialized training in their chosen research areas. Students receive broad training in environmental sciences through a series of core courses and specialized training through advanced courses and original research.
ScholarshipAmount: Full tuition waiver, a 12-month stipend, and health insurance benefits

ProgramName: Master of Environmental Studies
EnglishScore: Proficiency in English is a prerequisite for all students in graduate programs at Baylor. All applicants whose native language is not English must submit a score from one of the following tests: TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo. We also accept the Pearson Test of English (PTE).
Requirements: Admission to the MES program is granted through the Graduate School and follows the general policies and procedures of the Graduate School. Requirements include a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Applicants must submit GRE scores and satisfy general admission requirements of the Graduate School.
Description: The Master of Environmental Studies (MES) is a non-thesis degree that provides interdisciplinary training for students seeking careers in the private or public sector. With a flexible curriculum tailored to meet individual student interests, the MES degree allows students to acquire broad expertise across a range of environmental topics or in-depth knowledge in a focused area. This degree is designed for students from a variety of academic backgrounds and requires a minimum of thirty-six semester hours, which includes three hours of a professional internship. The MES is a non-thesis degree available in two tracks: professional and science communication. Students in the professional track typically aspire to careers in industry or government, while students in the science communication track focus on communicating environmental science to broader audiences through journalism, digital media, and other venues.
ScholarshipType: Merit-based scholarships, Graduate Assistantships (Teaching and Research), Tuition Remission

ProgramName: Executive Master of Business Administration (Dallas)
Description: The Baylor Executive MBA program in Dallas is designed for the mid-career executive who is on the fast track to the C-suite. With a collaborative environment, a curriculum focused on executive-level strategic decision making and a convenient once-a-month format, we offer a premier MBA program that has been transforming leaders in the DFW area for 30 years.
Accredidation: Hankamer School of Business is accredited by AACSB International.

ProgramName: Executive Master of Business Administration in Healthcare (Dallas)
EnglishScore: All international applicants must submit a test score that demonstrates English proficiency, unless they meet one of the exception criteria. Baylor accepts the TOEFL, IELTS, and DuoLingo exams. The Graduate School's minimum required score on the internet-based TOEFL (iBT) is 80. The minimum required score on the paper-based TOEFL (pBT) is 550. The Graduate School's minimum required score on the IELTS is 6.5. The Graduate School's minimum required score on the DuoLingo is 110.
Description: The Baylor Executive MBA Program in Dallas provides a specialized curriculum with a healthcare focus for experienced executives who are on a trajectory to the C-suite. Our 21-month program allows you to earn an MBA from a nationally-ranked institution without interrupting your career. You will benefit from a collaborative environment that brings together a diverse group of physicians, entrepreneurs, administrators, and other clinical and non-clinical professionals. Each student brings an average of 15 years of professional experience, with 8-10 years in management, which creates a dynamic classroom environment. In addition, our cohort format allows you to create a valuable professional network for life.
Accredidation: The Hankamer School of Business is accredited by AACSB International.

ProgramName: Doctor of Nursing Practice in Executive Nurse Leadership
EnglishScore: The Graduate School accepts the following tests for demonstration of English Proficiency: TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language), IELTS (International English Language Testing System), Duolingo English Test. Your scores should be sent directly from the testing service. Photocopies will not be accepted. Test scores must not be more than two years old. The Graduate School also accepts successful completion of the ELS Language Center's Intensive Level 112.
Description: The Baylor University Louise Herrington School of Nursing Doctor of Nursing Practice (DNP) in Executive Nurse Leadership (ENL) is a 30-month, 39-credit hour program for nurses who hold a Master of Science in Nursing (MSN) degree in nursing leadership, administration, or management from a regionally accredited institution. Students in this track must have a current, unencumbered license to practice as a Registered Nurse. The DNP-ENL program is offered through a hybrid format, which means the majority of the coursework is online with executive on-campus sessions each semester. The on-campus sessions are held in Dallas, Texas. The program is designed to develop nurse leaders who are prepared to lead and transform today’s complex and dynamic healthcare systems.
Accredidation: The Doctor of Nursing Practice degree program at Baylor University Louise Herrington School of Nursing is accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (http://www.ccneaccreditation.org).

ProgramName: PhD in Exercise and Nutrition Sciences
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit a score from one of the following tests of English proficiency: TOEFL (iBT or PBT), IELTS, Duolingo. This requirement is waived if the applicant holds a bachelor's degree from a U.S. accredited institution.
Requirements: Completed online application, including fee. All required supporting documents must be submitted through the online application system. Official transcripts from every institution from which you have obtained a degree. Resume or Curriculum Vitae (CV). Statement of Purpose: The statement of purpose should describe your reasons for pursuing a PhD in Exercise and Nutrition Sciences at Baylor, your research interests and experience, and your career goals. We highly recommend identifying and contacting specific faculty with whom you are interested in working prior to submitting your application. Three letters of recommendation. Official GRE scores are optional for the PhD program.
Department: Robbins College of Health and Human Sciences
Description: The PhD in Exercise and Nutrition Sciences is designed to provide students with an advanced understanding of the integration of exercise and nutrition to improve human health and performance. The PhD is an interdisciplinary program that includes faculty from nutrition sciences, exercise physiology, and physical therapy. Students will choose one of three concentrations: 1) Exercise & Nutrition, 2) Exercise Physiology, and 3) Nutrition Sciences. Each concentration is designed to provide advanced training in research and content knowledge specific to the discipline. Students in all concentrations are expected to conduct high-quality, impactful research that leads to publication in reputable peer-reviewed journals. All students will complete a core curriculum to gain a broad understanding of exercise and nutrition sciences and will select one of the three concentrations for an in-depth course of study. The curriculum provides a strong research core, including statistics and research methods, with additional coursework focused on the student’s concentration of interest. The goal of the PhD in Exercise and Nutrition Sciences is to train the next generation of researchers and scholars who can work in academic or industry settings.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Exercise Physiology
EnglishScore: For applicants who are not U.S. citizens, proof of English proficiency is required. Accepted tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL iBT (80), IELTS (6.5), Duolingo (110), or PTE (60). The test must have been taken within the last two years.
Requirements:
In addition to the general application requirements of the Graduate School, the following are required for the MS in Exercise Physiology:

Official transcripts from all universities attended
Resume or CV
3 letters of recommendation
Statement of Purpose
Please describe your academic and research background, your career goals, and how Baylor's graduate program will help you meet your career goals. Your statement of purpose should be 1-2 pages.
GRE is not required.
Department: Robbins College of Health and Human Sciences
Description: The Master of Science in Exercise Physiology degree program is a two-year program in the Department of Health, Human Performance, and Recreation. We have two tracks: a thesis track and a non-thesis track. Both tracks are designed to provide students an advanced understanding of the physiological responses and adaptations to acute and chronic exercise. In addition, students are provided the opportunity for research and an in-depth study of exercise physiology.

ProgramName: Doctor of Nursing Practice in Family Nurse Practitioner
EnglishScore: International applicants must submit a score from one of these three tests: TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo. This is a university-wide requirement, and it is rare for an applicant to receive a waiver. The minimum score for the TOEFL is 80 on the internet-based test (iBT), and we do not have a preference among the various forms of the iBT. The minimum score for the IELTS is 6.5. The minimum score for the Duolingo is 110. We also accept completion of the ELS (English Language Services) Intensive Level 112.
Requirements:
Application Requirements:
- Online application and application fee
- Transcripts
- Résumé or Curriculum Vitae (CV)
- Personal Statement: A personal statement describing your interest in becoming a Family Nurse Practitioner and why you believe you would be successful in the Baylor DNP-FNP program.
- Three Letters of Recommendation: At least one recommendation should be from a current or recent manager/supervisor. A professor, physician or professional colleague can provide the other recommendations.
- Official GRE scores (Not Required for Fall 2024 and beyond)
- Official TOEFL or IELTS scores (for international students)
- A recorded interview with a member of the LHSON Graduate Program faculty.

Prerequisites:
- Hold a bachelor’s degree in nursing (BSN) from a nationally accredited program.
- Hold a current unencumbered license as a Registered Nurse in the United States.
- Have at least one year of full time experience as a registered nurse (RN).
- Have an undergraduate statistics course with a grade of C or better.
- Have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale.
Description: Baylor University's DNP-FNP program prepares students with the skills and knowledge to serve as leaders in the nursing profession. Our Family Nurse Practitioner program is designed to prepare nurses with a Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) or a Master of Science in Nursing (MSN) for advanced practice as a family nurse practitioner. FNPs are prepared to provide primary care for persons of all ages in a variety of settings. The curriculum emphasizes health promotion, disease prevention, and the clinical management of common health problems. Upon completion of the DNP-FNP program, graduates are eligible to take the Family Nurse Practitioner national certification exam through the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC) or the American Academy of Nurse Practitioners (AANP). Courses are offered online with on-campus immersions and clinicals can be arranged in your own community.
Accredidation: The Doctor of Nursing Practice program at Baylor University is accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education, 655 K Street, NW, Suite 750, Washington, DC 20001, 202-887-6791.
ScholarshipType: Merit-based, Need-based, Dean's Scholarship, Alumni Scholarship, Military/Veteran Scholarship, Ministry Scholarship

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Film & Digital Media
EnglishScore: International applicants must submit a score from one of the following tests to prove English proficiency: TOEFL (minimum 80 iBT), IELTS (minimum 6.5), or Duolingo (minimum 110). Applicants are exempt from this requirement if they are a citizen of an English-speaking country as defined by the university or if they have a bachelor's degree from an accredited U.S. institution.
